SENT.plain: The syndrome of pseudotumor cerebri consists of headaches, difficulty with vision and papilledema associated with raised intracranial pressure (ICP) without localizing neurological mass lesions
Recently, an association of pseudotumor cerebri and renal insufficiency, chronic dialysis or renal transplantation has been noted
Loss of vision remains a serious threat in children with pseudotumor cerebri
We report two children who developed pseudotumor cerebri with impairment of vision 5 years after renal transplantation
An awareness of this association should prompt the nephrologist to investigate and treat the symptoms of raised ICP to prevent visual loss
